column2: Health Care Sector Contribution to the Miami MSA Gross Domestic Product
Source:  U.S. Bureau of Economic Analysis (BEA)

Unit of Measure:  Chained dollars used by the U.S. Department of Commerce.  Chained dollars are a method of indexing real dollar amounts by taking account of inflation over time. The indexing calculates dollar figures by using 2009 as the base year.
Notes 1:  These figures apply to the Miami MSA, which here is the geographic area defined by the BEA.  According to the BEA's definition, the Miami MSA is Miami-Ft. Lauderdale-West Palm Beach, FL.
Notes 2:  (D) means, according to the BEA, "Not shown in order to avoid the disclosure of confidential information; estimates are included in higher level totals."
Ambulatory health care services (in millions of chained dollars)
Hospitals and nursing and residential care facilities (in millions of chained dollars)
